text:
<@U1CTBUNEN>  - on the auditor question, I'd say that right now in terms of functionality having that role in there was really more of a "future" thought.  There's nothing really implemented that actually defines things / restricts what an auditor has access to at this point.  In terms of use cases:

1) read-only access to the data
2) ability to "re-link" transaction certificates given the proper cryptographic material
<@U0PB67X4K> thanks for info. What about the Pre-key tree
Is that supposed to work with the 'auditor' system role ? Or that's a stand-alone feature which could be used without using the auditor role?
technically it could be used without the auditor role
<@U0PB67X4K> is there a code sample to illustrate it?
negative on that one - I assume you meant the pre-key stuff for transaction certificates?
<@U0PB67X4K> just so I understand: the pre-key tree works with encryption of attribute keys ?
so a higher-level encryption key will be able to derive child-level keys and decrypt the attributes ?
